page.title: 08PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: THE D-BLOCK HAS NO RAILWAYS,SO LIKE MOST RURAL AREAS,BUS TRANSPORT IS VITAL.LIKE MOST RURAL AREAS,BUSES ARE FEW AND FAR BETWEEN.AUCHMUIR BRIDGE IS THE NODE OF THE BLOCK,THEREFORE WE SURVEYED BUS SERVICES THROUGH THE HAMLET.SINCE GLENROTHES IS THE LARGEST MAJOR SETTLEMENT IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO THE BLOCK WE EXPECTED MOST SERVICES TO TRAVEL EAST TO GLENROTHES.DURING THE NORMAL WEEKDAY,ONLY 2 SERVICES,LEAVING TILLICOULTRY AT 10.30 AND 15.30 TRAVELLED TO THE NEW TOWN,BUT 4 MADE THE RETURN JOURNEY AT 08.00,12.00, 14.20 AND 16.30 GOING TO GLENROTHES AND TILLICOULTRY.THIS WE FOUND CURIOUS .ON SATURDAY IT WAS 4 TO GLENROTHES, 09.00 AND 15.30 FROM TILLICOULTRY, 08.50 AND 13.50 FROM KINROSS BUT NONE THE OTHER WAY.NEEDLESS TO SAY,ON SUNDAY THERE WERE NO SERVICES AT ALL.
